remarks: Given the equivalences set in the hypotheses, there exist a proof where ch, th, ta, et match ze, si accordingly (Contributed by Jarvin Udandy, 7-Sep-2016.)
statement:
mdandyvr2.1 $e |- ( ph <-> ze ) $.
mdandyvr2.2 $e |- ( ps <-> si ) $.
mdandyvr2.3 $e |- ( ch <-> ph ) $.
mdandyvr2.4 $e |- ( th <-> ps ) $.
mdandyvr2.5 $e |- ( ta <-> ph ) $.
mdandyvr2.6 $e |- ( et <-> ph ) $.
mdandyvr2 $p |- ( ( ( ( ch <-> ze ) /\ ( th <-> si ) ) /\ ( ta <-> ze ) ) /\ ( et <-> ze ) ) $.
